txt.en:
'So, Longbough has sensed that the Even-rills are threatened? He has never been wrong, so even though I have not seen what he feels, I trust this threat to be real.

'The enemy is likely the Gauredain, Men from the North, the cold wastes of Forochel. They dabble in dark alchemy and evil magic, things that turn nature into abominations.

'Clear out the camp they have at the Even-rills. If even a few remain, then more will come.'
'So, as you defeated the Gauredain, they began to scatter and flee? Good! They will think twice before returning to that place.'
'The Even-rills supply all the water this lake holds. If they are made foul, the entire lake will become fouled as well.'
The Even-rills are a series of pools and waterfalls that meltwater from Forochel runs through before entering the lake of Evendim.
The Even-rills are north-east of the Eavespires.\n\nLithuifin asked you to head to the Even-rills and defeat the Gauredain there.
Talk to Lithuifin at the Eavespires
Lithuifin is at the Eavespires, south-west of the Even-rills.\n\nLithuifin will want to hear the Guaredain have been driven out of the Even-rills.
